ElementDescription: The NDAR Global Unique Identifier (GUID) for research subject
Subject ID how it's defined in lab/project
Date on which the interview/genetic test/sampling/imaging/biospecimen was completed. MM/DD/YYYY
Age in months at the time of the interview/test/sampling/imaging.
Notes: Age is rounded to chronological month. If the research participant is 15-days-old at time of interview, the appropriate value would be 0 months. If the participant is 16-days-old, the value would be 1 month.

ElementDescription: Sex of subject at birth
Notes: M = Male; F = Female; O=Other; NR = Not reported

ElementDescription: During the past month, how would you rate your sleep quality overall
Notes: 1=Very good, 2=Fairly good, 3= Fairly bad, 4=Very bad

ElementDescription: Do you have difficulty concentrating on the things you do because you are sleepy or tired
Notes: 1=Yes, extreme difficulty; 2=Yes, moderate difficulty, 3=Yes, a little difficulty, 4=No difficulty

ElementDescription: Do you generally have difficulty remembering things because you are sleepy or tired
Notes: 1=Yes, extreme difficulty; 2=Yes, moderate difficulty, 3=Yes, a little difficulty, 4=No difficulty

ElementDescription: In a typical week, on how many days do you do vigorous-intense exercise (10 min continuous)?
On an average day, how many minutes of exercise do you do?

In the space below, indicate name, dosage, and frequency of use (how many pills per day and for how many days) of all medications you have used in the past 30 days. In addition to prescribed medications, please include over-the-counter medications such as aspirin or Tylenol, Advil, nutritional supplements, antacids, antihistamines, decongestants, sleep pills, No-Doze, Vivarin, diet pills, nasal sprays, etc.).Please write N/A if you do not take any medications.
Tobacco/nicotine average usage past 30 days
Notes: Cigarettes per day

ElementDescription: Please list any past use of drugs in the following categories. Include both medical and non-medical (recreational) use. List how often you used the drugs and whether you had any unpleasant effects when taking the drug (examples: nausea, dizziness, disorientation, etc.). Type N/A in the text box if you have never used the drug listed. Next, select the appropriate answer for each drug listed regarding how often you used the drug. Stimulants (such as amphetamine or speed, uppers, cocaine, crack, methamphetamine, prescription diet pills, Ritalin). Please list the type(s) below. Next to the type, please include if you had a bad reaction.
Stimulants. How often have you used the drug?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = 1-10 times; 2 = 11-50 times; 3 = More than 50 times

ElementDescription: Tranquilizers or downers (such as Valium, Xanax, Halcion). Please list the type(s) below. Next to the type, please include if you had a bad reaction.
Tranquilizers or downers. How often have you used the drug?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = 1-10 times; 2 = 11-50 times; 3 = More than 50 times

ElementDescription: Opiates (such as Tylenol-3, codeine, opium, heroin, morphine, methadone, oxy, Darvon, Demerol, Percodan). Please list the type(s) below. Next to the type, please include if you had a bad reaction:
Opiates. How often have you used the drug?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = 1-10 times; 2 = 11-50 times; 3 = More than 50 times

ElementDescription: Marijuana (such as cannabis, hashish, THC). Please list the type(s) below. Next to the type please, include if you had a bad reaction.
Marijuana. How often have you used the drug?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = 1-10 times; 2 = 11-50 times; 3 = More than 50 times

ElementDescription: Other (such as glue, amyl nitrate, nitrous oxide, laughing gas, poppers, Whippets, general anesthetics, steroids). Please list the type(s) below. Next to the type, please include if you had a bad reaction.
Other. How often have you used the drug?
Notes: 0 = Never; 1 = 1-10 times; 2 = 11-50 times; 3 = More than 50 times
